page.title: 14The local doctor
page.content: The doctor gets up at half past seven. He works in the Leominster surgery from nine till twelve in the morning and between four and seven in the evening. In the afternoon he visits patients in their homes or at the Cottage Hospital.He is responsible for about 2500 patients and is on call every third day and every third weekend for urgent medical problems.He works with nurses,health visitors and mid-wifes.They have a clinic for babies and mummys who are having babies. The doctor said "We now have more powerful treatments and more complicated equipment to find out about what is wrong like x-rays. We have also developed vaccinations to prevent people becoming ill. We try and teach people to live sensibly to help them keep healthy."
